title: Conditions and Exhaustion
markdown:
# Conditions

Creatures can be affected by conditions that alter capabilities. Below are common SRD conditions.

> Attribution: Contains material from the D&D 5e SRD 5.1 by Wizards of the Coast, available under CC BY 4.0.

## Conditions (Summary)
- Blinded: Can't see; fails sight-based checks; attack rolls against have advantage; its own attack rolls have disadvantage.
- Charmed: Can't attack the charmer or target it with harmful abilities; charmer has advantage on social checks.
- Deafened: Can't hear and fails checks that require hearing.
- Frightened: Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of fear is in sight; can't willingly move closer to the source.
- Grappled: Speed becomes 0; ends if the grappler is incapacitated or if removed from reach.
- Incapacitated: Can't take actions or reactions.
- Invisible: Can't be seen without special sense; attack rolls against have disadvantage; its own attack rolls have advantage.
- Paralyzed: Incapacitated; fails Str/Dex saves; attack rolls against have advantage; any hit within 5 feet is a critical hit.
- Petrified: Transformed into solid substance; incapacitated; unaware; resistance to all damage; immune to poison and disease; other effects at DM's discretion.
- Poisoned: Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
- Prone: Disadvantage on attack rolls; attack rolls against have advantage if within 5 feet; disadvantage if attacker is at range; standing up costs half speed.
- Restrained: Speed 0; attack rolls against have advantage; its own attack rolls have disadvantage; disadvantage on Dexterity saves.
- Stunned: Incapacitated; can't move; can speak only falteringly; fails Str/Dex saves; attack rolls against have advantage.
- Unconscious: Incapacitated; drops what it's holding; falls prone; fails Str/Dex saves; attack rolls against have advantage; any hit within 5 feet is a critical hit.

## Exhaustion (Variant)
Exhaustion represents weariness with cumulative effects.

| Level | Effect |
|------:|--------|
| 1 | Disadvantage on ability checks |
| 2 | Speed halved |
| 3 | Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws |
| 4 | Hit point maximum halved |
| 5 | Speed reduced to 0 |
| 6 | Death |
